subject: Testing asynchronous calls
msgSnippet: I have an API that when I call it, puts an event on a queue somewhere.  Eventually the event is passed to an EventHandler object.  I d like to test the process
messageBody:
I have an API that when I call it, puts an event on a queue
somewhere. Eventually the event is passed to an EventHandler
object. I'd like to test the process of placing an event on the
queue and it being handled so I have a test method that posts the
event, I implement my EventHandler interface and in the method that
the interface provides I verify the data is what I posted. The
problem I am getting is that even though the assertion is thrown, the
Test failure is not included in the TestResult object. In addition I
pass in a PrintStream to the JUNit TestRunner but in this case, the
error output appears on System.out not my PrintStream. My feeling is
that what's happening is that my test method posts the Event, then
the flow of excution passes back to the TestRunner with no exceptions
thrown. Later the event is caught, and if it fails the exception is
thrown but by this time the TestResult object has already been
created. Is there a prescribed way of testing such methods?
